page.title: 02Redhill village
page.content: Redhill village is near the top of Red Hill,the centre lying just off the A38 on the road to Wrington.The name probably comes from the colour of the soil,which is clay. The village hall(with playing field) and church are in the centre of the village,but there are no shops here and the primary school closed in 1984. However there is green-grocers' van,a mobile library calling fortnightly and a pub(The Darlington Arms) on the A38. Wrington,a larger village,is under 2 miles away and used by Redhill people for local shopping,doctors and dentists.The local Brownies,Guides, Cubs and Scouts also meet there. The Wrington and Redhill journal is a locally produced monthly magazine taken by many households. The bus service through Redhill goes from Bristol to Weston-super-mare.
